subject: Re: [junit] MockObjects and static methods
msgSnippet: ... Looks like you found the answer ;-) ... Steve -- [Advert: Come to http://www.ot2003.org] A LISP programmer knows the value of everything but the cost of
messageBody:
Dave wrote:
> I have been trying to use MockObjects (usually as a small inner class)
> to break the coupling between the test target and the multitude of
> things it depends on. Unfortunately, we tend to use a lot of static
> methods in our architecture. Soooo... since you can't override a
> static method, I can't figure out how to mock out the dependencies.
> Anyone have a good solution to this problem?

> The only one I could think of was making stuff non-static.

Looks like you found the answer ;-)

> Dave
> dhanna@...

Steve

--
[Advert: Come to http://www.ot2003.org]

"A LISP programmer knows the value of everything but the cost of nothing.
A C programmer knows the cost of everything but the value of nothing."
(Todd Proebsting)
